definition: to lean against or on/to stand by the side of/to come near to/to depend on/to trust/to fuck (vulgar)/traditional military costume drama where the performers wear armor (old)

sentences.english: The legal foundation in China is not strong enough.
sentences.chinese: 中國的法制基礎還不夠牢靠。

sentences.english: This chair is not very strong.
Chains of gold are stronger than chains of iron.
sentences.chinese: 金鍊鎖人比鐵煉更牢靠。

sentences.english: All contract workers worry about the insecurity of their "paper rice bowl".
sentences.chinese: 這個廠的合同制工人都曾擔心“紙飯碗”不牢靠。

sentences.english: With your hands and arms at your side and the ball firmly under the attacking arms armpit.
sentences.chinese: 手和手臂垂於體側，球牢靠地置於攻擊手腋下。

sentences.english: I just hope the rest of this ship is space-worthy.
sentences.chinese: 我只希望這艘船其他部分也足夠牢靠。

sentences.english: Perfect man-machine engineering Unscrew perch pin ensures reliable connection.
sentences.chinese: 完美人機工程高位插腳防松設計，使插接更牢靠。

definition: to fit tightly (idiom)/to join seamlessly/to fit snugly
to maintain/to keep up/to hold together
